oh and for the tail control it needs the second and third set of pitch and roll disabled to work like normal. (right click on flap in game)

I will add that and invert the axis of the body flap in the cfg's. can also edit its rotation axis there

well that's it for me tonight, be back in a few hours

woooot! awesome aye
gnight lad. it is 8.15 pm here, kids are in bed now, time to test some things ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I did reverse reentries, hard reentries > 30Ã‚Â°, soft reentries <10Ã‚Â°, stalling over the runway, fast powered landing...i cant get it to break or flip around...nice work guys ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Its difficult to launch with a payload. It may not have enough dv to get a payload to orbit. It wasnt a heavy payload either. I only did one test though

I only tried with several probes, but that gone pretty well. Around 4 tons into 250 km orbit, ascend profile is 

gravity turn starts at 1 km, turn profile 64 %. Oh,ans just like the real shuttle belly up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
my payload may have just been too heavy, I'll test again when the game loads, I just installed a big mod and ATM is taking its time with it.
Its pretty cool. But i think the monopropellant is reduced too fast
